definition[0]: to allow someone to borrow something for a short time in exchange for money
example[0]: a little company that hires out boats to tourists
definition[1]: to arrange to work for someone
example[1]: They were so poor they had to hire themselves out on the farms.
definition[2]: to allow someone to use something or someone for a period of time in exchange for money
example[2]: They hire out photocopiers and other office equipment.
example[3]: a company that hires out computer engineers
